technical.question: Is RAM volatile memory?
alternativeAnswers: It is true that RAM is volatile.
RAM is a volatile memory.

technical.question: What does HTTP stand for?
technical.answer: HTTP stands for Hypertext Transfer Protocol.
alternativeAnswers: It is Hypertext Transfer Protocol.
Hypertext Transfer Protocol is what HTTP stands for.

technical.question: On which layer does the Transport layer operate?
technical.answer: The Transport layer operates on layer 4.
alternativeAnswers: It operates on layer 4.
Layer 4 is where the Transport layer operates.

technical.question: Which layer does an Ethernet switch operate on?
technical.answer: An Ethernet switch operates on layer 2.
alternativeAnswers: It operates on layer 2.
Layer 2 is where an Ethernet switch operates.

technical.question: Is a Virtual Machine the same as a Container?
technical.answer: No, a Virtual Machine is not the same as a Container.
alternativeAnswers: They are not the same.
Virtual Machines and Containers are different.

technical.question: What does SSH stand for?
alternativeAnswers: It is Secure Shell.
Secure Shell is what SSH means.

technical.question: Do we use FDDI in modern networks?
technical.answer: No, we do not use FDDI in modern networks.
alternativeAnswers: FDDI is not used in modern networks.
FDDI is no longer used in modern networks.

technical.question: Is IPv6 used in modern networks?
technical.answer: Yes, IPv6 is used in modern networks.
alternativeAnswers: It is true that IPv6 is used.
IPv6 is indeed used in modern networks.

technical.question: Is Token Ring a modern networking protocol?
technical.answer: No, Token Ring is not a modern networking protocol.
alternativeAnswers: It is not modern.
Token Ring is no longer a modern networking protocol.

technical.question: Do we have other types of IP addresses than IPv6?
technical.answer: Yes, we have other types of IP addresses than IPv6.
alternativeAnswers: There are other IP addresses besides IPv6.
It is true that there are IP addresses other than IPv6.

listening.text: A stitch in time saves nine.
An apple a day keeps the doctor away.
Absence makes the heart grow fonder.
Birds of a feather flock together.
The pen is mightier than the sword.
Rome wasn't built in a day.
A penny saved is a penny earned.
When the going gets tough, the tough get going.

logical.question: If all Elephants are Mammals and all Mammals are Animals, are all Elephants definitely Animals?
What is the meaning of verbose?
A person who saves money is frugal or extravagant?
A person who has a fear of heights is acrophobic or claustrophobic?
The study of the human mind is known as psychology or physiology?
A government ruled by a single person is called autocracy or democracy?
A collection of poems is called an anthology or a thesaurus?
The scientific study of insects is entomology or ichthyology?
A person who loves to eat is called gourmand or ascetic?
A person who is known for telling lies is dishonest or truthful?

grammar.question: Rearrange the words to form a correct sentence: 'so tired was he that he fell asleep immediately.'
grammar.answer: He was so tired that he fell asleep immediately.
alternativeAnswers: So tired was he that he fell asleep immediately.
So tired he was that he fell asleep immediately.

grammar.question: Rearrange the words to form a correct sentence: 'at no time did she reveal her true feelings.'
grammar.answer: At no time did she reveal her true feelings.
alternativeAnswers: She did not reveal her true feelings at any time.
Her true feelings were not revealed at any time.

grammar.question: Rearrange the words to form a correct sentence: 'not only did he finish the race, but he also broke the record.'
grammar.answer: Not only did he finish the race, but he also broke the record.
alternativeAnswers: He not only finished the race but also broke the record.
In addition to finishing the race, he broke the record.

grammar.question: Correct the subject-verb agreement in this sentence: 'The group of tourists are visiting the museum today.'
grammar.answer: The group of tourists is visiting the museum today.
alternativeAnswers: The group of tourists is going to visit the museum today.
The tourist group is visiting the museum today.

grammar.question: Correct the subject-verb agreement in this sentence: 'None of the books on the shelf belongs to me.'
grammar.answer: None of the books on the shelf belong to me.
alternativeAnswers: None of the books belong to me.
The books on the shelf do not belong to me.

grammar.question: Correct the subject-verb agreement in this sentence: 'The pair of shoes are on sale.'
grammar.answer: The pair of shoes is on sale.
alternativeAnswers: The pair of shoes is available at a discounted price.
The shoes are on sale.

grammar.question: Correct the subject-verb agreement in this sentence: 'Either the manager or the employees has to attend the meeting.'
grammar.answer: Either the manager or the employees have to attend the meeting.
alternativeAnswers: Either the employees or the manager has to attend the meeting.
Both the manager and the employees have to attend the meeting.

grammar.question: Replace the incorrect word in this sentence: 'The news about the accident were shocking.'
grammar.answer: The news about the accident was shocking.
alternativeAnswers: The news about the accident was distressing.
The news of the accident was shocking.

grammar.question: Replace the incorrect word in this sentence: 'She was very economic with her words during the interview.'
grammar.answer: She was very economical with her words during the interview.
alternativeAnswers: She was very concise with her words during the interview.
She was very sparing with her words during the interview.

grammar.question: Replace the incorrect word in this sentence: 'The teacher gave us a feedback on our assignments.'
grammar.answer: The teacher gave us feedback on our assignments.
alternativeAnswers: The teacher provided us with feedback on our assignments.
The teacher gave us some feedback on our assignments.

extempore.topic: The impact of social media on mental health

diction.story: Ms. Olivia Bennett visited a renowned historical landmark. The ancient structure stood majestically, showcasing intricate architectural details. She learned about its significance and the historical events associated with it. A knowledgeable guide provided interesting anecdotes and facts. The visit offered a profound insight into past eras.

questions.question: Who visited a historical landmark?
questions.answer: Ms. Olivia Bennett visited a renowned historical landmark.
alternativeAnswers: Olivia Bennett visited a famous historical landmark.
The landmark was visited by Ms. Bennett.

questions.question: How did the structure appear?
questions.answer: The ancient structure stood majestically, showcasing intricate details.
alternativeAnswers: It appeared majestic with intricate architectural details.
The structure showed intricate majestic details.

questions.question: What did she learn about?
questions.answer: She learned about its significance and associated historical events.
alternativeAnswers: Its importance and history were what she learned.
She acquired knowledge of its past significance.

questions.question: Who provided anecdotes and facts?
questions.answer: A knowledgeable guide provided interesting anecdotes and facts.
alternativeAnswers: Interesting facts and anecdotes were given by a guide.
A guide offered facts and captivating stories.

questions.question: What did the visit offer?
questions.answer: The visit offered a profound insight into past eras.
alternativeAnswers: A deep insight into bygone eras was offered.
It provided great understanding of previous times.

diction.story: Dr. Benjamin Carter conducted a new scientific experiment in his laboratory. His objective was to observe the reaction of certain chemical compounds. He carefully measured all ingredients and recorded observations precisely. The experiment yielded promising results for future research. This outcome could impact various scientific applications.

questions.question: Who conducted a new scientific experiment?
questions.answer: Dr. Benjamin Carter conducted a new scientific experiment.
alternativeAnswers: Benjamin Carter performed a new scientific experiment.
A new experiment was conducted by Dr. Carter.

questions.question: Where did he conduct the experiment?
questions.answer: He conducted the experiment in his laboratory.
alternativeAnswers: His laboratory was where the experiment occurred.
The experiment was performed inside his lab.

questions.question: What was his objective?
questions.answer: His objective was to observe reactions of certain chemical compounds.
alternativeAnswers: Observing chemical compound reactions was his objective.
He aimed to see chemical compound interactions.

questions.question: How did he record observations?
questions.answer: He carefully measured ingredients and recorded observations precisely.
alternativeAnswers: Observations were recorded precisely after careful measurements.
He precisely recorded his careful observations.

questions.question: What did the experiment yield?
questions.answer: The experiment yielded promising results for future research.
alternativeAnswers: Promising results for future research were yielded.
It produced hopeful results for upcoming studies.
